meanings.definition: To put away or store in a specified place.
meanings.sent1: She stowed her toys neatly in the box.
meanings.sent2: He always stowed his tools in the toolbox after work.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stowed away nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Memories were stowed in the corners of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The pirate stowed the treasure chest deep in the cave.

meanings.definition: To pack or arrange in a compact way.
meanings.sent1: She stowed her clothes tightly in the suitcase.
meanings.sent2: He stowed the camping gear efficiently in the backpack.
meanings.sent3: The magician stowed the rabbits in the hat for the trick.
meanings.sent4: Hope was stowed in the small locket she always wore.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces were stowed snugly in the box.

meanings.definition: To be packed or stored in a specified place.
meanings.sent1: The luggage was stowed in the overhead compartment.
meanings.sent2: The books were stowed on the shelves in an orderly manner.
meanings.sent3: Laughter stowed away in the room, waiting to burst out.
meanings.sent4: Secrets were stowed in the hidden compartment of the desk.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of summer was stowed in the memories of the past.
